subject: Nutrition
title: The Protein Powder Industry
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Protein Powder Industry.

hook.text: Protein powder is a $20 billion industry. Most buyers don't need it and would benefit more from food.

buildup.text: Whey, casein, soy, and pea powders offer convenient protein but no other nutrients beyond protein itself.

discovery.text: A chicken breast provides protein plus iron, zinc, and B vitamins. Powder delivers only the protein.

twist.text: Independent testing found 40% of powders contained heavy metals above safe recommended levels.

climax.text: Powders are useful for convenience, but marketing has made them seem essential when food works better.

punchline.text: Real food beats powder for everything except convenience.

quiz.question: What did independent testing find in protein powders?
